newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner CEO-no interest in Postbank.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner CEO-no interest in Postbank.

text.p: The chairman of Germany's Dresdner Bank AG on Friday said the bank had no interest in taking over or buying a stake in Postbank, the postal bank currently due for privatisation.
Juergen Sarrazin told the bank's annual general meeting that media reports that Dresdner was interested in Postbank were untrue.
"We are neither interested in taking over Postbank or in taking a stake in it," Sarrazin said, noting that the bank had in 1995 considered these options but had dropped the project.
However he said Dresdner would be pleased to accompany the Postbank's debut on the bourse, expected to go ahead sometime this year.

Dresdner's press office had already denied media reports on Thursday which said working papers from the London investment bank Schroders indicated Dresdner was interested in taking a stake in Postbank.

The information from Schroder laid out possibilities for the privatisation of Postbank by the federal government, with Bonn favouring Dresdner's recommendation due to its profit potential, according to the media reports.
